text: Werner Zimmermann (born 19 May 1915, date of death unknown) is a Swiss retired slalom and sprint canoeist who competed from the mid-1930s to the mid-1950s. As a slalom canoeist, he won three medals at the ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships with a gold (Folding K-1 team: 1949) and two bronzes (Folding K-1: 1949, Folding K-1 team: 1951). As a sprint canoeist, he competed in two Summer Olympics. At the 1936 Summer Olympics, he finished sixth in the K-2 10000 m event. Twelve years later, he finished 11th in the K-2 10000 m event. ==References== * ==External links== * Category:1915 births Category:Canoeists at the 1936 Summer Olympics Category:Canoeists at the 1948 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic canoeists of Switzerland Category:Year of death missing Category:Swiss male canoeists Category:Medalists at the ICF Canoe Slalom World Championships
title: Werner Zimmermann
